Class OptimalPage

extends java.lang.Object
    Program Defined From "OptimalPage" Class, Executed Within "Main" Class

    • Method Detail

      • numericStringValidation

        private java.lang.String numericStringValidation​(java.lang.String msg)
        Eliminates Need For Exception Handling As Method Ensures Input Is A Positive Numerical String. If Not, Method Loops And Asks For Valid Input.
        Parameters:
        msg - Message To Be Shown To User If Invalid Reference String/Frame Is Entered
        Returns:
        tempString To Be Saved Within Variables "refString" , "frameSize"

      • populateArrayList

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> populateArrayList​(java.lang.String targetString)
        Takes "refString" Entered By User, Creates New ArrayList Of Type Integer, Splits "refString" Into Separate Numbers, Fills "tempArrayList" With Each Number.
        Parameters:
        targetString - "refString" Entered By User
        Returns:
        tempArrayList Copies Contents Into "refArrayList"

      • populateArray

        private java.lang.String[] populateArray​(int targetFrameSize)
        Takes "frameSize" Entered By User And Fills Every Index Of "tempArray" with Asterisks
        Parameters:
        targetFrameSize - "frameSize" Entered By User
        Returns:
        Copies Contents Into "memArray"

      • initialize

        void initialize​()
        ONLY METHOD To Ask/Recieve USER INPUT

        Initializes Class Variables...

        "refString", "refArrayList", "frameSize", "memArray",

        And Uses...

        "numericStringValidation()" "populateArrayList()" "populateArray()"

        Methods To Achieve The Following...

        "refString" -> INITIALIZE -> "refArrayList" "frameSize" -> INITIALIZE -> "memArray"

        Method Is Called Within Main Class.

      • displayArray

        private java.lang.String displayArray​(java.lang.String[] targetArray,
                                      int targetFrames)
        Displays Contents Of "memArray" To User, To Be Used Within Print Statement.
        Parameters:
        targetArray - Used As A Temporary Array To Copy Contents Into "memArray"
        targetFrames - Used As A Max Limit To Reach Last Index Of "targetArray"
        Returns:
        tempString Used To Embed Contents Of Current Array In A Print Statement

      • currentRefEquals

        private boolean currentRefEquals​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> targetArrayList,
                                 java.lang.String[] targetArray,
                                 int currentCount)
        If The Current Reference Variable Within "refArrayList" Is Found Within ANY Index Of "memArray"...Return True [No Page Fault], Else Return False [Page Fault]. If Index At "memArray" Is Not A Numerical Value [Page Fault].
        Parameters:
        targetArrayList - Used As A Placeholder For "refArrayList"
        targetArray - Used As A Placeholder For "memArray"
        currentCount - Used As A Placeholder For "i" Within "simulate() -> checkForFault()"
        Returns:
        isEqual Used Within "checkForFault()" Method To Determine If Page Fault Occurred

      • fault

        private void fault​(java.lang.String[] targetArray,
                   java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> targetArrayList,
                   int currentCount)
        Called Within "checkForFault()" Method To Handle Page Fault. Prior To Execution Program Knows There Is A Page Fault. First Portion Of "if...else" Block Replaces Any Non Numerical String Within "memArray" With Numerical Value From "refArrayList". Second Portion Of "if...else" Block Uses Personal Solution To "Optimal Page Replacement Algorithm".

        Effectively, The Current Values Across All Index's Of "memArray" Are Compared Against The Remaining Values Of "refArrayList" To Calculate The Index And Value Within "memArray" That Will Not Be Seen For The Longest Period Of Time. This Index Is Replaced By The Current Value Of "refArrayList".

        Parameters:
        targetArray - Used As A Placeholder For "memArray"
        targetArrayList - Used As A Placeholder For "refArrayList"
        currentCount - Used As A Placeholder For "i" Within "simulate() -> checkForFault()"

      • checkForFault

        private void checkForFault​(java.lang.String[] targetArray,
                           java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> targetArrayList,
                           int currentCount)
        Called From Within "simulate()" Method. This Method Uses The "fault()" Method To Determine If There Is A Page Fault. This Method Also Tracks And Increments "pageFaults", And "currentCount" Variables. "currentCount" Is Derived From "i" Within The "simulate()" Method Which Cycles Through All Elements Of "refArrayList". User Is Notified of... Current Value Within "refArrayList" -> Current Contents Of "memArrayList" As Well As If A Page Fault Occurred Or If There Was A Hit [Number Already Existed Within "memArray"]. The Current Number Of "pageFaults" Is Then Displayed To The User.
        Parameters:
        targetArray - Used As A Placeholder For "memArray"
        targetArrayList - Used As A Placeholder For "refArrayList"
        currentCount - Used As A Placeholder For "i" Within "simulate()"

      • simulate

        void simulate​()
        Traverses "refArrayList" And Notifies Users Of Page Fault or Hit For Each Element Found Within "refArrayList". Method Is Called Within "Main" Class.
